Reviews.Title: “SPARKLING CLEAN!”
Reviews.Author: ilovetotravel1995
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. Curteous staff and great breakfast. I stayed here with my two youngest children on a trip to Seaworld and the Wild Animal Park. Seaworld is about at 10 minute drive away and the Wild Animal Park is about 25 minutes and I found it refreshing to be away from the crowds. Their beds are full-sized so take note of that if you are traveling with adults or teens. But as for us, they were perfect. The beds were comfy and clean and we slept very well. We are Hampton junkies so you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Families....”
Reviews.Author: businesstraveler212
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent hotel for families exploring the San Diego area. Check in was prompt and the room was comfortable for a family of four. The hotel is in a great location, right off the highway surrounded by restaurant, grocery stores and other small shops. There was also plenty of free parking. All of the hotel staff that I encountered were friendly and made sure that we had everything that we needed. While the bed was a little too soft for me, it was perfect for the other members of my family. The bathroom was spacious and the shower amazing. The water pressure was just the way I like it. The only frustration with the room is the lack of electrical outlets bedside. It made it difficult for me to charge my cell phone and lay in bed which is something that I like to do. The breakfast was also good. I was glad to see that there was a different hot offering daily. I received a thank you postcard from the owners which added a nice touch to round out our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SSmpls
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay in or near San Diego for one night after arriving at the airport, before traveling farther north the next day. We wanted to avoid expensive parking fees. This place was perfect. Nicely (and apparently recently) decorated, very comfortable, and quiet. A delicious complimentary hot breakfast...we were very pleased with everything. We found a Fillipi's restaurant nearby with its wonderful Italian food.

Reviews.Title: “nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Postbro1
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel. Clean and comfortable without a doubt. The bed was actually comfortable which is something I usually don't find when I travel. The price went up for my Sunday night stay which was surprising. Guess that is the business traveler gouge! Nice that I was given a chocolate chip cookie upon check out! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, best bed ever and lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: mzbrendat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came to San Diego for a rest. This hotel definitly facilitated that need. The bed is , quite honestly, the best I have ever slept on. They use duvets instead of those awful bed cover-things older hotels use. The pillows are full, firm but comfy. The staff cleaned well and clearly left 'our stuff' alone. There is a fidge in the closet and grocery stores nearby (not walking distance though) to get any special items you may want or need. The hotel is right by the hwy 163 junction so getting anywhere is really relatively easy. The staff were very helpful, courteous, efficient and happy. All the staff seemed to genuinely like working there which says a lot to me about how they will do their jobs. They always had hot coffee and water available as well as coffee maker in the room. It was just easier to go downstairs and get water when it was already done for us. Though this hotel is rightnear the freeway and airports,it is very quiet (I am very noise sensitive) and we had a real restful visit. The staff were very knowledgable about the city and had great tips for where to eat, shop, site see etc. We stayed a week at this hotel and every day it was the same, quiet, calm, happy. There was a shriner's convention staying there on the weekend and we did not hear anything from them. Breakfasts were from 6 am-10 am and always had eggs and another hot item, waffles ( not eggo, real ones!) Fresh fruit, various cold cereals, real hot porridge, bagels, muffins, toast, english muffins and more. Juice, milk, coffee and tea. The breakfast lady is very nice and works hard to keep it well stocked and fresh. The eating aa is not that large but also not cramped and it seemed to work. There is no hot tub but the pool is beautiful and clean. Parking was easy and a gas station is litterally 2 doors down from the hotel. Though this hotel is not downtown, I would rather stay here as a 'hub' for my trip than get stuck in downtown traffic every day. I hope you find this helpful and you enjoy your stay as much as we did. Its cheaper on the weekends by-the-way :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mixalti
Reviews.Content: I was solo and wanted a clean, nice place to stay, for a few days. This location and nice area exceeded my expectations and than some. Nice morning breakfast and nice room.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable here”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel022
Reviews.Content: I've now stayed here on two separate trips and after this second stay, I'd definitely recommend this hotel. It is very clean, inside and out. Check-in is quick, there is plenty of free parking and an entrance in the front and in the back (with your room key), making it easy to get to your room. Again, clean rooms, comfortable bed and huge tv. There is complimentary breakfast, which I tried this time, and they had a great variety of hot and cold food. There is a wonderful, large fish tank in the lobby as well, which I love. I visited Christmas weekend, and there was a beautiful Christmas tree in the lobby, and I was wished a Merry Christmas that morning by a staff member passing in the hall-very nice! The only negatives I can mention are that it is a little farther away from the main hotel area, but it's right off the freeway so it makes it easy to get anywhere, and that the windows don't open. Not a big deal, but it's a minor annoyance if you're someone like me and would prefer a little fresh air over using the a/c sometimes. I will be considering this hotel again the next time I stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “New and clean”
Reviews.Author: GregRidgecrest_CA
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business because the Residence Inn next door was full. Nice clean hotel, rooms are nice, everything was great. It will be even better soon, they are building a pool.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: David H
Reviews.Content: My stay was for 3 nights. This was a pleasant hotel with a very friendly staff. My only objection was that the bed was just too soft for me. Very cushy, but woke up with some back ache every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Dave E
Reviews.Content: We enjoy the Hampton chain and tried this location for our trip instead of the Del Mar location. Loved this place! Great location, easy access, usual great service,staff, breakfast but best of all--it seemed like it was brand NEW! Everything was modern and updated! We will be staying here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “clean and good location”
Reviews.Author: KOinDenver
Reviews.Content: I like to stay at Hampton Inns because of the consistent cleanliness, continental breakfast and friendly staff. On this occasion I was stuck in a meeting with my son's college advisory so I missed late check out. When I returned to check out, (I admit it was late afternoon) I was forced to pay for entire day or be out in 5 minutes. I offered a "late fee: but no such thing existed. As my son and I scrambled to be out while the manager and housekeeping staff stood outside our door, I left a couple of valuable things (to me they were valuable - college paperwork) But when I called that evening to arrange shipping at my expense - they were already discarded. I realize "NO LATE CHECK OUT" is a corporate policy, and I appreciate that. What I didn't appreciate is the way this manager handled it. I don't expect special treatment just because I am a Hilton Silver Memeber and have a long history with Hilton - but as a customer off the street - management could have been more respectful. Front desk, housekeeping - everything else was fantastic. (except the pool was under repair and not available.)

Reviews.Title: “Typical excellent Hampton”
Reviews.Author: Benched45
Reviews.Content: Typical excellent Hampton. The only negative was the poor wireless internet on the second floor. Had to go to the lobby to get good signal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice facility, marine tank, 42" LCD TV, crowded breakfast”
Reviews.Author: hog4oc
Reviews.Content: Very clean and well run Hampton Inn location. Very close to the San Diego air show. Pro: Quite Big Marine Tank at the lobby 42" LCD TV Con: Breakfast is crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: FigPow
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hampton Inn overnight as I had an interview at a company up on Mira Mesa Blvd. The hotel was very well maintained - clean and comfortable. The hotel staff were very nice and helpful. I was able to use the hotel's printer to print out some documents and I used their microwave to make some popcorn. The complimentry breakfast was very good. And for me, the hotel's location was fine since I was only a 15 minute drive from my interview location. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others travelling on business or who are in the area for a short time.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: DauphinTravelers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on our way from Long Beach to the San Diego Airport. Yes, there is construction outside and yes, the area it is in is a 'commercial' district, but none of that affected our stay. Most hotels and motels adjacent to major highways are in commercial areas, so I can't hold that against the Hampton Inn. The reception staff were efficient, friendly and knew what customer service was. When checking in, my only request was for a 'quiet' room. The front desk staff made a change and put us on the 5th floor, instead of the 4th, which was appreciated, as a high school sports team must have been on several of the lower floors. The room was large, very clean and I was impressed with all of the ammenities in the bathroom. I was worried that the breakfast in the morning may not be open by the time we had to depart for the airport, but it opened at 6:00 AM, which was great. Plenty to eat, including waffles, and I enjoyed watching the fish while we ate. If in the area again, I would not hesitate staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Choice”
Reviews.Author: dantogo
Reviews.Content: At this writing, the hotel is undergoing some exterior renovation. Ultimately it should improve the first impressioin. The location is pretty good if doing business in the area. However, turning West out of the hotel puts you in an area that has an abundance of "gentlemen's clubs," fast food, and car dealers. The availability of medium quality, non-Asian restaurants in either direction seems a bit limited. The last night I was there was the night of the big blackout. By the time I got back the emergency lights had died and I had to find my way to the room by cellphone light. Once in the room (yes, the door locks worked), I had a one-cell flashlight in my suitcase, and now it will always be there. The hotel does not serve dinner but acommodated guests by thoughtfully. providing breakfast items. They didn't have to do that but I wouldn't have been able to find anything otherwise. In general the hotel is clean and well furnished. Had HD TVs in teh rooms. There is no "Business Center," but there are acouple of computers in the lobby so boarding passes can be printed. More than that might be a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but...”
Reviews.Author: marlo
Reviews.Content: Surprised to see that there is massive construction on the entrance of the hotel. Maybe upon reservation which I made thru their website, there should be a "notice" before finalizing reservation that repairs are being done to let clients know if it is alright for them to have some inconvenience. This hotel is about 15 mins away from downtown San Diego where all the activities are. Nice clean room, but crowded breakfast area. When checking out, I noticed a statement in the invoice saying something abut "I requested for a weekday delivery of USA today, if refused, a credit of .75 will be applied to my account". I asked the front desk person Daniel about it and was surprised to hear him say -- "we do not have any newspaper and I do not know anything about that, if you have the invoice with you, let me look at it". I had to get the invoice from the car and bring it for him to read. I am not after the .75 cents. i am just surprised that he shrugged his shoulders and again said "I do not know anything about that. I did not even know it was written there" Amazing how hotel policy is unknown to a front desk person who should be the "know-it-all".

Reviews.Title: “Typical great Hampton experience”
Reviews.Author: acorn27
Reviews.Content: Very nice Hampton Inn. Clean, very nice room, very nice lobby. Good breakfast. Very friendly and helpful staff. It is a bit west of San Diego but still not too bad of a drive to Sea World, Zoo, etc, maybe 20 minutes. The hotel is just south of the Miramar Air Station, and a couple of days the planes taking off were extremely loud when we were outside of the hotel, but inside the room we really could not hear the planes. The pool is nice, but no hot tub. The cover on the A/C unit was broken and was quite noisy. I tried to adjust it and got it slightly quieter. Very soft beds, some like that some don't.

Reviews.Title: “AAA++++++”
Reviews.Author: TJsdaddy2005
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel!!! great frendly staff!!! room was big and really nice. pool was great. lots of great eats near by as well as awesome breakfast in lobby. Price was great. Close to all the fun in San DIego. front desk has directions to a lot of the local attractions. price was half of cheepie hotels in Hotel circle.almost felt like we were at a 5 star resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great City”
Reviews.Author: TucsonWorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: This is a really great stay, especially if you have a car in San Diego and don't mind taking the few extra minutes (literally) to get to all of the fun stuff. This was away from the "pricey pay a bunch of money to park" kind of hotels and had a beautiful atmosphere and service. What I most appreciated was that we stayed on the weekend and it was packed; however I never heard a peep from the hallway, the neighbors or noise from the freeway. San Diego is such a beautiful place with so much to do- this hotel is a nice compliment and a nice place to rest up in the evenings. One minor heads up- the breakfast area was WILD on the weekends....lots of people and very busy. It was a reasonably nice breakfast each day but a bit hectic on the weekend mornings. Nothing that I would complain and nothing I would mind; but definitely a heads up for those of you looking for a quiet breakfast while you read the paper. Great stay and looking forward to staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value with superlative service located within 30 min of most major attractions”
Reviews.Author: Agcanuck
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hampton Inn-Kearny Mesa from 27-July to 2-August, 2011. Used HHonors points for the first 4 days, and paid the last 2. Booking made by calling the HHonors reservation number. Got a very good "VIP" rate that beat anything being advertised on the different travel search engines - didn't try HotWire. My family has always had good experiences with Hampton Inns, and this one is the best so far. Access is a breeze from the airport or driving in - on California SR163 at Clairemont Mesa Blvd, just south of SR52. Torrey Pines/La Jolla is just 20-30 mins away depending on traffic, ditto for downtown/airport/Balboa park so the location was ideal. Lots of free parking. We had two different rooms, both about the same - only difference was a queen in one and two doubles in another. Otherwise the rooms were spotless, fresh clean linens on those great Hampton beds, fridge in the closet for water etc. Big flat screen TV and WiFi (access code is printed on the sleeve containing the room key cards). Normal outside pool, two PCs to use for email etc. in the lobby, printer available on request. Nicely equipped fitness centre. Breakfast, also as usual, very nice - fruit, juice/coffee, cereal, milk, "make your own waffles", really nice doughnuts, as well as bagels and some sort of egg/breakfast meat dish (omelettes/sausage, scrambed eggs with bacon, etc. - different every day). Typical for Hampton Inn and one of the reasons we like the chain. Always hot, reasonable quality and there were three ladies keeping everything moving because this is a VERY busy hotel on weekends. Where this hotel shone, however, was in the staff. Everyone was friendly, consummately professional, and very patient but "Robert" was truly exceptional. Friendly, knowledgeable (we took him up on his dinner recommendations and weren't disappointed once) he is a treasure and my wife and I truly are big fans of his. He even loaned us his personal bottle-opener when we bought a celebratory bottle of wine and forgot that we didn't have one ourselves! Kevin and the ladies in the morning (never got their names) were also wonderful. Also, the hotel has a big binder full of pre-printed MapsQuest and Google Map directions from/to the hotel and different attractions in the city, and for the most popular ones (airport, Sea World, La Jolla Cove etc.) they have little index cards - on one side how to get TO the attraction - flip it over and you have directions on getting from the attraction back to the hotel. Wonderful. We were worried about not staying near the beach, but the central location of this hotel and the world class care the staff take care of their desks, plus the usual, though in this case EXCELLENTLY executed services common to the Hampton Inn brand make this an excellent choice for a day, a week or even a month's stay. Wonderful place, and if we ever go back to San Diego this is where we're staying.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: historyteacher50
Reviews.Content: This is more like a 3 1/2 star rating. Stayed here for Comic Con - right off the 163 freeway which takes you all the way to downtown San Diego in 15 minutes. Wow - free parking, free internet and free breakfast. Breakfast had eggs, potatoes, bacon, bagels, fresh fruit, cereal, yogurt (and constantly restocked). The only problem was there was not enough seating - I sat with other strangers at a table to eat. Lots of places to eat on Clairemont Mesa Dr and close to Mission Valley shopping center (right off the 163 and less than 8 minutes). Housekeeping staff was very nice and accommodating. The front desk was not very efficient because I had booked 2 rooms and she did not put the rooms next to each other (even though the room was vacant next to me and I had requested it months in advance!!!) ALso requested high floor and she did not put me on a high floor. A little bit of "couldn't care less" attitude I guess. Construction was going on and every time I opened the shades, there were construction workers right outside the window - the hotel has scaffolding all over it. There was an outdoor swimming pool (dusty from the construction) but no jacuzzi.

Reviews.Title: “okay stay with great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Sunflower76
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights after the good reviews here at tripadvisor. We like Hampton Inns because of the good Breakfast on the House. Positive are the good size of the room, the free parking and WiFi, the best fitness room during our entire journey, free coffee, tea, juice and apples in the lobby, the huge TV and the friendliness of the staff. Of course the breakfast was tasty but the sitting area was way too small for all the guests, it was crowed every day which brings me to the negative sides. Negative are the cleanness of the room (we found hairs in the bathroom and on pillows!) and the fact that they are renovating outside (which we were not informed before) and our window was covered with scaffolding. Luckily we havenâ€™t been in the room to often. They have an outdoor pool but we didnâ€™t want to swim in there because of the dirt of the renovation everywhere. The location is a bit away from downtown but near the freeway, so this is not a real problem. All in all the stay was decent but I think we will look elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, Reasonable location”
Reviews.Author: Hotrod855
Reviews.Content: Stayed here three nights after a one night in Redondo Beach as part of a 3 week road trip. Staff were very pleasant. Good Wi-Fi, Large flat screen TV. Good breakfast selection, although the seating area was a bit small, can be a problem with a lot of guests. At the time we stayed the whole building was covered with scaffolding for exterior refurbishments. To be honest apart from the view be interrupted from the window it and the workforce never caused a problem, but then we were out most of the day! Overall a nicely presented hotel (Apart from the scaffolding!)

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hampton Inn, super clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: angelfire0916
Reviews.Content: Rooms are extremely clean. Room was also very quiet, and we had a very good night's sleep. Room interiors and lobby are updated and very nice. They are working on the exterior, although I hardly think it needed it. The lobby is very clean and organized as well. The front desk staff is very friendly and helpful. Breakfast is excellent, a good variety of food, compared to other Hampton Inn breakfasts. They keep a nice selection of lemonade, water , teas and coffees in the lobby throughout the day. This is probably the nicest Hampton I have been to, and I've stayed in about 10 different properties throughout the country. We would definitely stay here again, even if it is a short freeway's drive to other attractions.

Reviews.Title: “what great service”
Reviews.Author: navymom1007
Reviews.Content: we were very happy with all services - except for one thing - after check in my husband and i were walking to the elevators and there was a slight elevation in the floor around a 30 degree angle and i tripped and fell - i could not see the elevation of the floor , this small area of the hallway have no overhead track lights and very dark and as well as the dark carpet color - but i was blessed to have no injuries .

Reviews.Title: “Second visit and not disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: L0veSanDieg0
Reviews.Content: This is our second time staying at this property. They are undergoing a facelift, new exterior paint, etc. This didn't affect our stay. As always the staff is OVER THE TOP friendly, greeting you every time you enter and exit the lobby. They are so helpful. The breakfast area is small, but accomodating. Usual breakfast fare with make your own waffles each morning, etc. The rooms are sufficient as far as size is concerned, very, very clean. I walked around in socks in the room and they weren't dirty at all. This property is only 6 miles north of Hotel Circle, a short drive to everything. The rate includes free parking, which is rare in the San Diego area, an added bonus for sure! The only change would be to add something, such as weather stripping to the door of the room, as you could see light coming through underneath and along the doorframe edge. That's a little unsettling when you want privacy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Semi-Industrial Location”
Reviews.Author: NorCalKat
Reviews.Content: Hotel is right off freeway and in a semi-industrial location, very convenient to Hwys 163 and 805 and lots of shopping, little restaurants, and fast food nearby. Accommodations were clean and quiet, bed was very soft. Pool looked inviting but it was cloudy & cold during my stay. Hot breakfast was good, and staff were friendly. Downtown San Diego, beaches, & area attractions were a short drive away.

Reviews.Title: “"So Sold Out" they don't need to care about guests' requests (or reviews!)”
Reviews.Author: DEN31
Reviews.Content: It's a shame the management staff at this property and at Hilton Corporate failed, because the hotel would rank average or above average were it not for service deficiencies from managment. Larger-than-average rooms, a standard continental breakfast, ample parking, and gracious front-line staff made my stay here worthwhile. Some aircraft noise from the nearby military base, but it's San Diego - good luck NOT hearing military aircraft! My issue arose when I discovered my work colleague had booked a double-double and I, a king-bedded room ... with our rate varying by $10. When I asked for a minor variance on rate, so we could bill identical hotel charges to our client, the kind desk staff referred me to the GM. I know she was the General Manager not just by her namebadge, but by her clear need to announce her title to me. She promptly corrected my adjective, ensuring I now know that a $10 variance in rate is not "minor." She then declined my request. I felt this was unacceptable, to which her fallback position was to raise my colleague's rate by $5 and lower mine by $5. I was then lectured on how "incredibly busy and sold out" the hotel was. My response was (an admittedly toothless) threat to check out, given that her hotel is "so busy" she could re-sell my room to another guest at a higher rate. She seemed perfectly content if I were to have elected that option. The feedback I left with Hilton Worldwide was met with an auto-response e-mail about how important my business is and a promise to get back in touch ... but I haven't heard anything. I average about 100 room nights a year. Through the actions of their GM at Hampton Kearney Mesa, and lax response from Guest Relations at Corporate, Hilton's given me nice cause to cut up my HHonors Elite-level card and shift my business to another, more gracious operator.

Reviews.Title: “Another shout out for this hotel”
Reviews.Author: lite2shine
Reviews.Content: I had a couple of choices but after reading the reviews here I decided to try this hotel and am glad I did! The hotel is very close to highways and yummy restaurants. Free parking and internet is always a plus. The front desk staff was very friendly. The room was clean and I can't ask anything more. I'll definitely stay here again next time I'll visit San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: graciesmom0921
Reviews.Content: We really had a great stay at the Hampton Inn - Kearny Mesa. My husband was staying there for business and we joined him for the last few days. Our room was clean & quiet, free parking, internet and breakfast in the morning were all included. We checked out and headed to Coronado to be closer to the beach, but the hotel we were staying at there was not very good so we checked out and returned to the Hampton Inn for our last night in town. It is a short drive from downtown (maybe 15 min), but totally worth it since we knew what we were getting -- a great spot @ a great deal. We will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: litetravler
Reviews.Content: The Hampton Inn at Kearny Mesa is a bit of a drive from downtown and the beaches, but well worth it. We stayed a week and had to extend our stay for family business--I ended up being there almost two weeks. The staff was friendly and the hotel nice and quiet, clean, decent breakfast items to last us until we found a late lunch around 1 or 2 each day. The room had a fridge and good Internet connection. Free parking was appreciated; again, this is about four or file miles north of Hotel Circle. The hotel has laundry facilities, too - two washers and two dryers, which we needed due to the longer stay. It is near the Black Angus and Butcher Stop restaurants, if you want steak (we didn't) and the Souplantation (which is a cafeteria like Sweet Tomatoes in the Bay area). I would recommend this to anyone and will stay again in the future. If I could change anything, it would be to add a hot tub by the pool. Our days were quite stressful, and it would have been nice to relax later each day. The second suggestion would be more and better television stations.

Reviews.Title: “Really lovely”
Reviews.Author: gailhouston
Reviews.Content: My husband and I checked in for a one night stay .... One of the nicest Hampton Inns. Room was quite large ... Fabulous large flat screen television ... Bed was very comfortable .... pillows were nice too. Good water pressure in the shower and very friendly front office staff Too!! Very convenient to the interstate .... Will definitely stay there again when we return to San Diego

Reviews.Title: “OMG! Though not a 5* hotel officially this one offers amazing service”
Reviews.Author: vorsoni
Reviews.Content: When I was booked in this hotel I was told "this is a very small hotel, very simple, and not so great but it should do because it is close to your meeting place". Well, sorry guys but I don't agree. Though it is no Plaza on the 5th avenue in NY, this hotel offered such a great level of service and such a quiet room with comfy mattress that it compares very well with the 5* hotels I have been to! Checkin with Robert went through very quickly and with a big smile. I needed to check a few emails and print a contract? No problem, free wifi everywhere, printer in the office. I needed to fax a contract? No problem Robert was here to do it and for FREE. Gym? check! clean, well equipped, large TV screens. Room? Very quiet, bathroom just finished with all the amenities. Mattress and quilts amazingly comfy and QUIET!!!!!!!! I slept like a baby. 24/7 there is a tea/coffee area with a great choice of varieties + lemonade for the kids. Breakfast is not your usual FREE breakfast: it has fresh fruits, fruit salad, waffles, muffins, scrambled eggs, etc..... Frankly, this is the best hotel on the block! Two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Front desk people were very helpful”
Reviews.Author: AprilTwoCats
Reviews.Content: Our very large, boisterous family stayed at the Hampton Inn Kearny-Mesa over a 5 day period for a family event. Definitely would recommend this for similar needs. The front desk staff was excellent, very helpful and friendly. They had little cards with directions to and from the major tourist sights. If they didn't have a card, they used Google Maps to create the directions. The fellows on duty at night had menus from several restaurants that delivered to the hotel (Carmen's is great for Mexican food, but you might have to go pick it up yourself). We regularly took over the breakfast area and the lobby seating area. The breakfast was nice, with pre-made egg dishes that changed every day, waffle maker, nice choice of juices, coffee that was available all day, and a beautiful fish tank that fascinated my young nieces and nephews. The second day we were there, the breakfast lady fed the fish while the kids were there and kept to that schedule for the rest of our stay. Very nice touch. There is a nicely outfitted workout room, an outdoor pool, and we saw a large conference room off the lobby. The room was very clean, had a little refrigerator, free WiFi and king-size bed. Two computers were available in the lobby and you could print on the hotel printer. My only complaint has to do with the linens. They were clean, but the bed had the feather top mattress. The mattress pad didn't quite reach around the mattress or the elastic was washed out because I kept fighting with the linens when the pad would let go during the night.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: JackieRaymond
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hampton Inn, Kearny Mesa, San Diego in September 2010. This is a fairly new hotel and we had a large room with sofa and 42" plasma TV. Good hot and cold breakfast included in price with plenty of variety. Tea and coffee available in lobby at all times. Nice swimming pool but a pity there is no jacuzzi - also seemed difficult to obtain pool towels from reception. Reception staff were not particularly helpful and seemed to spend a lot of time on the phone to friends while customers waiting for attention!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - good value”
Reviews.Author: mikebees
Reviews.Content: Upper tier Hampton. Entire hotel was fresh and clean. Staff was helpful with local information, prompt and efficient. Close enough to the attractions and Miramar (with a car). I'd stay again without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service...GREAT value”
Reviews.Author: L0veSanDieg0
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last weekend 9/24-9/26. Upon check-in we were greeted by Sarah, who was very helpful in giving us directions to the nearest bank. Every staff member that we encountered greeted us with a smile and friendly hello. They were all very attentive to our needs and exceeded our expectations. The property is 22 years old, but must have gone through recent, extensive renovations. The room was immaculate, fresh, and clean. There is a small refridgerator in the closet, which is very convenient. I am a hotel snob and was pleasantly surprised by the room's appearance. The lobby is very nice. The breakfast area is small. I don't think they had a full house the nights that we stayed, but had it been the middle of summer it would have been a tight squeeze in the area provided for the breakfast. The food was typical buffet style with DIY waffles, etc. The fresh fruit was definitely a nice touch! We had leftovers to heat up for lunch from the previous night's stay and the staff allowed us to use the microwave in the pantry area. That evening we wanted coffee, but didn't want to drive anywhere....we called downstairs and the gentleman on staff that evening told us he was just finishing up making fresh coffee and had cookies waiting for us! What a nice surprise to wind down the evening. The pool looked really refreshing, but we didn't bring our swimsuits to enjoy it. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the San Diego area. It is fresh, clean and the staff is wonderful. It's only 6 miles from Hotel Circle, where the prices can be almost double during certain times of the year, not to mention this property has FREE PARKING!!!! Only a short 15 drive to anywhere you want to go while in San Diego. I also HIGHLY recommend Filippi's Pizza Grotto in Little Italy. There is a location near the hotel, but we were told by the waiter at the Little Italy location that that location is owned by someone else and the Little Italy location is the original. Upon stepping inside the smell was AMAZING! I knew it would be a great restaurant...and it was. The *best* homemade sausage I have ever tasted! Also, I recommend the Cabrillo National Monument and tidepools, check out sunset at Sunset Cliffs or the nearby Point Loma Nazarene College for some nice views!

Reviews.Title: “No surprises and well done hotel”
Reviews.Author: TJM1973
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights at the end of August 2010, for work-related training. Room very clean and quiet. The military jets landing at Miramar can get noisy, but they never landed after dark. The breakfast has a some variety of eggs each day and either potatoes or meat, 4 juices, 3 coffees, plus hot water for tea or cocoa; a waffle maker; donuts and pastries, bread, bagels, plus butter or margarine, honey, peanut butter, syrup or small packages of jam/jelly, a variety of fruit each day (once was thawed berries). Apples and bananas during the breakfast, and just apples available all day (along with coffee). Room service was excellent, except one day we ran out of toilet paper and it was not refilled at regular service for some reason. Nice easy access to a hwy/frwy. Some restaurants, grocery stores, and gas stations also nearby. Wife used the weight room/gym and neither of us used the clean pool or coin washer/dryer. Front desk personnel all friendly and competent. I used the free high-speed wireless internet every day and it worked perfectly. Would be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: TrvlnDixie45
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for my recent stay in San Diego based on other reviews by TripAdvisor members, and I'm glad I did! The hotel is conveniently located off the CA-163 freeway and about 2-3 miles from the 805 freeway. Upon arrival, I found parking to be a breeze and my check-in was effortless. My room was ready on arrival, and as I settled in, I noticed how clean and neat the room was. The room is spacious, with a very comfy bed and a selection of either soft or firm pillows. Inside the closet, there is a mini-fridge (perfect for keeping water bottles cold), several hangers, and an iron and board. The room also has a desk, a large LCD tv, a pull-out sofa, a full length mirror, and an alarm clock radio. The comfortable and spacious bathroom (wonderful shower!) is stocked with toiletries (shampoo, conditioner, soap) and also has a hair dryer that is not attached to the wall, which makes it convenient if you want to dry your hair watching tv while someone else uses the bathroom. There is a coffeemaker also, with sugar, cream and coffee packets. There is free breakfast every morning, and even though it can get a bit crowded (mainly 8-9am), it does offer an assortment of breads, bagels, donuts, eggs, sausage, waffles (make your own), instant oatmeal, coffee, tea, juice, and hot chocolate. I really enjoyed the breakfast and if it's crowded, you can always take it back to your room. As another review pointed out, the staff keeps the area clean and well stocked. If they start to run low, the friendly staff will gladly help you get what you're looking for. There is a meeting room and a fitness center also located on the main lobby floor. The fitness center offers a variety of options to work out as you overlook the pool area. Besides the location next to freeways, there are plenty of restaurants, a market, fast food options, and a Walmart down the road. It is also located right next to a gas station. My room was on the second floor and had no complaints about the noise levels or lights. The area is pretty safe and I would recommend both solo travelers and families to stay here as a "base camp" to see the sights in San Diego. There was no hassle at check out, and I will be staying here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Smoking allowed at pool”
Reviews.Author: CAtourist
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel has been remodeled, the airconditioning units are quite loud, interfering with sleep. I assume they did not replace the units. The fitness room is great and open 24 hours. The pool, however, is unusable for nonsmokers. The hotel allows guests to smoke at the pool which I think is irresponsible given that secondhand smoke is a known cause of cancer. Also, when I complained that I was not able to use the pool because of their policy, I was not given even a token discount. I complained as soon as the issue arose and again on departure. Hampton Inn has a 100% satisfaction guarantee. I wasn't expecting to not pay at all, but a small discount would have been nice since I was unable to use the pool due to their own policies.

Reviews.Title: “A Bit Out Of The Way - But Otherwise Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Boeing767
Reviews.Content: Not close to downtown, but if you have a car and can overlook that ... there is no reason to stay anywhere else. Downtown hotels charge to park. We arrived at 10:00 AM after an all night flight, and a drive down from LA. Kristin checked us right in. The room was standard-issue Hampton, but clean and comfortable. The TV was huge, although we didn't really watch it. The pool looked inviting, but again, we didn't find time for it during our one night stay. We liked: Souplanation, just down the street, the service (smiles from EVERYONE), the breakfast, the cleanliness, the lobby (great fish tank), the ample parking just outside the door. We didn't like: Noise from Miramar until 9:00 PM. Not Hampton's fault ... and nothing they can do about it - just something to be aware of if you are a light sleeper. I would return without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: BBNipomo
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights and enjoyed the location, the breakfast, the pool, and the comfortable rooms. We would stay here again. Staff was friendly and helpful. Room was clean and appropriately furnished.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: abcd90
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean. The beds are very comfortable. The breakfast was more than adequate, and there was daily variety. The front desk staff was always welcoming, helpful, polite, and ready to serve. We would stay there again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, Excellent”
Reviews.Author: gmbassist
Reviews.Content: I came to San Diego to bring my boyfriend to the Zoo - we go to the zoos around us all the time and I decided this would be a nice treat. The front desk man was very nice and efficient, and gave me my keys and told me where my room was located. The room was much more than I expected it to be. Comfortable and HUGE bed, clean sheets, a sofa, a huge TV, and a giant bathroom were waiting in my room. There were plenty of towels, a bit of a small closet, but overall a great, spacious, clean room. No funky smells or anything of that sort, and no sounds from any rooms around us (which I know were occupied). In the morning there was a breakfast buffet, which wasn't really impressive, but it was a "free" breakfast and it was all you can eat. Check out was easy and convenient. Overall, no one poked and prodded me too much, they weren't overwhelming and they accommodated me as I needed. I definitely like this hotel because of the location, the rooms, and because everything went very smoothly.

Reviews.Title: “The Reviews are True”
Reviews.Author: talimoth
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 5/4-5/6. This was wonderful place to stay. I have never stayed at a Hampton Inn before and never intended on staying at one. After reading the reviews I figured I would give it a try. I was glad I did. The hotel was clean and the staff was friendly at check-in. The room was spacious and the bed comfortable. It had a big flat screen television. I was impressed with the free morning breakfast that was served each day. It included cereals, pastries, fruit, juices and there was also egg and sausage. This hotel is not close to any major attractions but is close to the freeway. I usually stay at Courtyards so this was a pleasant surprise. I will be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience!”
Reviews.Author: 123puff
Reviews.Content: My husband, five year old, and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights based on the positive reviews. We were not at all disappointed. My kid didn't even want to leave. He loved the hotel and wanted to stay in our room most of the time. The bed was like sleeping on a cloud, the room furniture was modern and clean, and the decor was very tasteful. And I must emphasize, EVERYTHING including the bathroom, was immaculate. I am very picky when it comes to hotel cleanliness and this place was spotless, from the lobby to the hallways to the room itself. The breakfast was tasty, with a nice selection of items to choose from (hot and cold) and there was fresh coffee available all day. We plan to go back to San Diego (we live in LA) just so we can stay at this hotel again :)

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel for business travellers”
Reviews.Author: wwwstudyofmakeupcom
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel for business travellers. Love the free wireless and breakfast. Gym area is sleek and well-located. Beware, if you're in rooms 108 or 208, you're windows face the pool so that could get noisy during busy summer months.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value for the money - Especially the Business Traveler”
Reviews.Author: Aeh_One
Reviews.Content: One of the nicest Hampton Inns that I've stayed. I'm a Marriott Courtyard customer, but based on my stay at this Hampton, I may have to reconsider if they're all this nice! Nice bathrooms with Marble, clean tub, spacious. Great bedding. At $130/night - this is a great value for the money. I don't normally rate "chain" hotels. Coffee and morning breakfast??? Well let's just say that there are plenty of restaurants in the area too. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Loved every bit of my stay”
Reviews.Author: SunnyDTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights during new years. I chose this hotel based on the other TripAdvisor reviews, and I was happy that I did! The service was excellent with quick check-in and check out. I requested a "quiet room away from the elevator" because this is usually what I am left with when I ask for the AAA rate. This time they actually honored my request! The rooms were spotless and clean, and the lobby very homey with free coffee, tea, cocoa, water and lemonade available. The staff was always smiling and welcoming. There is also a nice tank in the lobby that makes it even more of a relaxing area. Breakfast and wifi were free. I was on the top floor (Room 500) and unfortunately did not have a great wifi connection. I did, however, have a nice view of the pool. There were two computers in the lobby area that were free to use. There was a pool, meeting room, and work out room on the lobby level. Breakfast consisted of cereal, donuts, toast/bagels, fresh melons and whole fruit, hardboiled eggs, do it yourself instant oatmeal, scrambled eggs and either sausage or biscuits and gravy. Beverages were 4 juices, tea, coffee, cocoa, milk. It was similar from day 1 to day 2, so perhaps they could have changed it up a little bit. There was no do-it-yourself waffle iron, but perhaps there wasn't much counter space for it. The breakfast area is pretty small, but they are nice enough to offer you trays so you can bring the food up to your room or take it on the road if you have a busy day planned. Let me say, it was more than enough to keep me happy. The staff was really good about keeping an eye on it and always refreshed it. I have been ot other places where they purposely delay refilling food to save money. That was NOT the case here, they monitored it and kept the food coming! The hotel is close to the 163 freeway which is a quick shot to downtown. I liked it better than staying in the hotel circle area. There is a lot of Chinese food down the way on Convoy and a 99 ranch, Food4Less and WalMart if you need to purchase anything. The room itself had a nice fluffy bed. It was if you were sleeping on a giant pillow. There was also a small couch, a desk, a large LCD TV and a small fridge in the closet. I did not see a safe (if that is important to you) but did read that the front desk had one. There was also a hairdryer, iron, ironing board, and coffeemaker. The room heater was a little bit on the loud side, but I am a light sleeper. Everything inside the rooms and hallways was clean and new. Another slight complaint is that the elevator was a bit slow. All in all, my complaints were minor and I had a good time at this hotel. I would definitely stay here again if I were to be in the San Diego area. By the way, the neighborhood is not that bad (crime wise)...it has a lot of small businesses and is right by a freeway, so it certainly does not have a "neighborhood" feel to it, but it is not unsafe or scary. I would recommend those who are visiting San Diego to stay at this hotel as it is very centralized to shopping as well as the attractions and was reasonably priced!

Reviews.Title: “The Best!”
Reviews.Author: rara111
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best Hampton Inn that we've stayed at. The quality of this hotel is superior, from the lobby on up to the rooms themselves. It was so nice that we extended our stay an extra night - the beds are fantastic, nice breakfast assortment, lots of parking and it's only a few minutes to everything around San Diego. There are a few restaurants down the road from Panda Express to Subway. Check in and out was easy, quick and professional - hotel was extremely clean. Only minor flaw was that there is some sort of convention center behind the hotel and they were having a loud concert of some sort for a while - other than that it's an absolutely fantastic place!

Reviews.Title: “Quite Surprising”
Reviews.Author: Jaid96
Reviews.Content: I would normally consider a Hampton Inn a 2 star type of hotel, but this hotel was far better then I expected. The rooms were all recently redone, and the beds were very comfortable. The huge flat screen tv and granite bathroom counters were a nice touch. The room also came with a refridgerator (it took me a bit to find it as it was in the closet). The morning breakast was hearty and the gym equipment was all brand new. The only con was that the walls were pretty thin and the maids were a little pushy. Great for business!!!! If your looking to just visit San Diego, Id reccomend staying a bit closer in. Its not far, but its at least a 10-15 min ride on the highway from downtown SD and at least the same to the closest beach.

Reviews.Title: “Updated, clean hotel, so-so breakfast”
Reviews.Author: jfordfan
Reviews.Content: I know this is an older hotel, but they have done a wonderful renovation job. The beds are soooooooooo comfortable, the bathrooms are new(ish), they have new HD TV's and our closet had a small refrigerator. The staff was very nice. The fitness center seemed nice and they offer coffee, tea, lemonade and hot chocolate 24/7 in a very nice lobby area. This is not the place for you if: you need closet space for clothes, a relaxing spa at the end of the day, a good breakfast ,mind sitting at a desk with the air conditioner blowing on you or a comfortable bath tub. Breakfast eggs were disgusting, but there are a variety of pastries and fruit, and it is crowded at breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Surprise !”
Reviews.Author: Austin2Texans
Reviews.Content: We were staying at a Hampton Inn further North of SD over the New Years holiday and decided on the spur of the moment to drive closer in to the city to be near some planned activities. HHonors was closed on the holiday, but the staff at the Hampton Inn Kearny Mesa helped us resolve a problem with Hilton points so that we could have a reward stay. I have stayed at dozens of Hampton Inns around the country and this one has some of the nicest accommodations, as well as a very helpful staff. I would definitely stay here on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “not a bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveladdict28
Reviews.Content: the place was really clean and breakfast was great. close to touristy things. they even sent a postcard after i returned home to thank me for my stay

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Seeing-America-241
Reviews.Content: You really can't go wrong with a Hampton Inn. When I was looking around for a hotel for a trip to San Diego I found this hotel to be much cheaper then the downtown choices. We were pleased with our choice. This Hampton Inn is about 10 miles from the tourist areas of downtown San Diego. Parking is free and we never had a problem finding a spot. There is a decent breakfast in the morning, the rooms are clean, the staff is pleasant and helpful, and there is a large plasma TV in every room. Driving into town was easy since this hotel is located right of Hwy 163 so the cost savings far outweighed the drive time. If you are looking for a great option in San Diego give this Hampton Inn a try.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, good value”
Reviews.Author: swirlinabc
Reviews.Content: We're winding up a very nice stay here. I've stayed at several locations in San Diego. This hotel is one of the best values I've had. San Diego is not an inexpnsive destination. For the price, the location and amenities are very nice. Location is conveniently just off the freeway. We had a room facing the freeway, but noise was never a factor. Rooms are not the largest, but decorated quite nicely. Free wireless internet and breakfast are very much welcomed. The pool is not too large, but serviceable. The exercise room is very well equipped. There is a very nicely appointed meeting room. I didn't use it, but it is very nice. The lobby is very nice with a very large fish tank. There are plenty of restaurants within a short drive, though not much within walking distance. Overall, I would stay here again in a heartbeat when my travels take me back to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Watch the 48-hour Cancellation Policy”
Reviews.Author: mghkb4
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel before. Typical Hampton Inn quality near a not so great neighborhood (adult clubs about a block away), but closest Hilton family hotel near my customer. Neighborhood scared me but I was pleasantly surprised with the quality inside the hotel. I was willing to overlook the bad neighborhood. I was scheduled to return to the area for another customer visit and reserved this hotel again. Unfortunately the meeting got postponed. I called the hotel to let them know the day before my trip and was told there was a 48-hour notice not a 24-hour notice. Didn't matter that I am a regular Hilton Honors customer, Doesn't matter that I have stayed there before and that I would be back in the area when the meeting was rescheduled. I suppose management has not been taught the value of retaining frequent business travelers. And to think I've suggested this hotel to colleagues. I'm beginning to question my loyalty to the Hilton chain. My colleagues are recommending the Marriott because their cancellation policy is not this ridiculous. I think the Hilton family of hotels just lost a valued customer.

Reviews.Title: “A+ I would go back in a hearbeat”
Reviews.Author: ihave2dogs
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the Miramar Air Show. This was a perfect choice as it is conviently located next to the highways used to get there and about a 10 minute drive. Our room had two double beds so there is NO pull out sofa bed. The beds were comfy (pillow top) I was afraid it would be too soft as I have back problems but I woke up pain free. One bed had synthetic pillows and the other bed has feather pillows. We booked 5 in the room. They do NOT have roll away beds here. The little one slept in the chair with footrest as it was big enough for her. They were kind enough to bring extra blankets and sheets for it. The 42" plasma TV in the room was GREAT! Although they do have wi-fi, they still provide a computer in the lobby for anyone to use which had the biggest monitor I have ever seen. It looked like our Plasma TV in the room. There is a mini fridge in the room. I did miss the microwave as at another Hampton Inn they not only provided one but also popcorn! That was missed. The lobby is beautiful with a very large aquarium that separates check-in from the breakfast area. There are about 7 tables to eat at. Also two sitting areas with sofas. One secluded area with sofas sported another Plasma TV .The food was great for a continental breakfast. It included cereal, fresh fruit (apples, bananas, mixed cut up fruit), yogurt, toast, muffins, eggs, ham, donuts, bagels, coffee, hot chocolate, fruit juices and milk in an all you can eat display. It was crowded on our morning but many seemed to be going to the Air Show like us and were on the same schedule. Some took it to their rooms instead since seating was sparce for a time being. Coffee, tea and hot chocolate were available at night. I wish there had been some cookies to munch on. :) It has a nice workout area. I counted 14 machines. It overlooks the pool and of course, sports another large Plasma TV. The pool was ordinary but it was steaming warm while raining outside. Staff was very friendly. Parking convenient and free. Yes, there are two nudie bars down the street. But far enough away that it didn't spill over into this area. Next door to the hotel is another hotel and on the other side, condos. Also on the same street is a Souplantation, Cocos, Walmart, a grocery store, Starbucks, McDonalds, LA Fitness ( a very large and nice one) and several others places to eat. I was most impressed with the cleanliness. Super Clean! Everything seemed brand new. And, the owners of this hotel even sent a nice thank you card to our home afterwards. Impressive again. I paid $138 with a AAA discount. I felt it was worth it. I would go back again- Absolutely!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: vodice
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in late Aug. Check in was very quick and effeicent even though we arrived very early. The room was very clean, modern and comfortable and included a great 42 inch HD plasma TV. The pool area was very quiet and clean with fresh towels. Breakfast was well stocked witha good variety of food. Pretty much the same as the only other Hampton inn we have stayed in at Orlando. We would be happy to stay here again as the hotel is only 10 mins drive from most of the must see things in San Deigo.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: andyjaydrew
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay. Rooms are eighter new or just like new. Nice, larger marble bathroom, 42'' plasma TV, free breakfast with one hot item daily and lots of cold(cereal,donuts,muffins,fruit,toast and lots of drinks). Pool is not large not small not cold. About 5 miles from seaworld. Gas station, mini mart, taco bell, Wendys, Inn and out, Outback and lots of nice places to eat within 1 mile. Also 2 strip clubs that I did not go to. The place is very very clean and like new. Will go to San Diego again, will stay here and no where else. If you stay here, you WONT be disappointed. Cant say enough about the place

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton Inn at Kearney Mesa this past month. While driving to the hotel, I was a little concern since the freeway seemed to take us away from the downtown area. However, we were so glad that we choose to stay at this hotel than on hotel circle. The rooms were very clean, white sheets and comforter, wide screen TV, clean bathroom and good amenities. There is a small refrig but no microwave. The hotel is very quiet. It was too cool to use the pool so maybe the noise level was lower than usual. However, the hotel is clean. The gym has up to date machines and enough of them. We like to work out and found this hotel to have more machines than others we stayed at. The breakfast was very good. Muffins, toasts, bagels, sausages, eggs (steamed), scones (they are delicious when warm), plenty of fruit and cereals. The food was very fresh, including the cut fruit. Hot tea and coffee available in the evening. They do have DSL and a computer with Internet access in the lobby in case you wanted to check the weather, attractions, etc. We found the location to actually be convenient. It is near two major freeways and it usually took no more than 15 minutes to get anywhere in San Diego. After the hussle and bussle of the crowds, it was nice to stay at a hotel where one can just relax. There is a Black Angus a few minutes away and other restaurants down the street. They also have a small, small Korean town with good restaurants and small stores. We love Korean food and found the prices comparable to home. I would recommend this hotel if you are visiting the area. It was better and cleaner than the Embassy Suites that we usually stay at for a comparable price. Plus the staff was nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “An inviting place in an uninviting area”
Reviews.Author: Aimless
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel which is unfortunately located in a scruffy neighborhood, including "Adult XXX" stores, "totally n*de bars", dimly-lit used-car lots, and a run-down Ramada next door. But inside, the lobby is quite nice, has a guest computer terminal and printer available, and the staff was very friendly, even at near-midnight. The room itself was lovely, had a 42" HD plasma TV, and a VERY comfortable pillow-top bed. Our daughter (a young adult, not a child) also got a good night's sleep on the sofa-bed. The bathroom was interesting - very nicely decorated, with granite countertop, brushed nickel faucet, Rainhead shower with bowed curtain rod, and water-saving fixtures, but the sink counter was unusually high, probably around 38", with open shelves below. Everything except the Kleenex holder and the little toiletries were on the shelves. The blow-dryer, coffee-maker, ice bucket and cups were way down on the bottom shelf near the floor. The towels were stacked on the middle and upper shelves, but there weren't any towel rods for hanging them up after use. Breakfast was a treat, especially nice since it's compimentary. Their "hot" items included sausage patties and French toast sticks (no eggs), and they also provided fresh fruit (both whole apples and bananas and a "salad" of cut-up melons and grapes), yogurt, cereals, hot water for tea and/or instant oatmeal, several pots of coffee (including "robust"), whole and low-fat milk, real half-and-half, juices, and a nice variety of breads, bagels, muffins and pastries. The dining area was also larger than most, with plenty of tables as well as sofas and chairs near another TV. Some of the staff is strangely misinformed about what the hotel offers, however. After I booked the room online, I called the hotel directly to ask if they provided feather pillows. The girl who answered said, "No," so we packed our own. When we arrived: feather pillows on the bed. A nice surprise, but it was frustrating that we'd wasted luggage space. Since we weren't going to arrive until close to midnight, and would be tired after a very long day of driving, I also called ahead to ask if they would kindly pre-make the sofa-bed for our daughter (I figured my Hilton Honors Silver VIP status should be worth SOMETHING!) Sarah, the hotel manager, assured me it would be taken care of. When we got to the room, though, the sofa-bed still looked like a sofa, so I called the front desk to see if we had been given the correct room, explaining the sofa-bed promise. He answered, "Our rooms don't have sofa-beds." Huh? Anyway, when we opened up the sofa-bed, it was made up and ready to go. So - kudos to Sarah the manager! On the merits of the hotel itself, I wouldn't hesitate to come here again. But if I needed to stay in San Diego for longer than one night, and had a choice of neighborhoods, I might look elsewhere just because the area here made me somewhat uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Clean, modern, and convenient.”
Reviews.Author: degreemd
Reviews.Content: This is a very solid hotel. I was pleased with how modern and clean it was. Great workout room, good breakfast, and close to all major freeways and the beachs are about 15 minutes by car. The beds were so comfortable and the large flat screen tv was totally unexpected. It seems like it would be a noisy area, but the hotel was very quiet and the back area was well lighted and very safe feeling. I lived in SD for 2 years and I know the area pretty well - I would not stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: XESA33A
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at this hotel for two days to see for the first time, places of interest in this seaside town. I will have to say that the front desk person, Robert, was a real help to us for our entire stay. All front end people should be as friendly and helpful as he was to us. He gave us recommendations for dinner ( The Godfather), directions to the San Diego Zoo and was just helpful and cheerful in doing so. The hotel itself is in final stages of renovations and is the nicest Hampton Inn we have ever stayed at ( that big screen TV was Awesome ). Breakfast was plentiful and the rooms are really decorated nicely ( and may I add all new air conditioners, too ). It's only about 8-10 miles from the airport and convenient to the downtown areas. We just finished a cruise on the Diamond Princess to the Mexican Riviera, but we found a real diamond in this hotel. For all you fish tank lovers, you will be amazed to see the tank in the front entrance. And remember, if you need a question answered - definitely see Robert, as I am sure he will help you, like he had helped us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mjpena
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this property from Feb. 17 â€“ 20 and loved it. This was our first visit to San Diego. We rented a vehicle with a GPS system (definitely worth it but thatâ€™s another review) and we were close to many of the attractions about 10 to 15 minutes away. We considered staying in the Hotel Circle but are glad we decided against it because it seemed congested. The hotel and our room were exceptionally clean. The bed was extremely comfortable which was great after long days of sightseeing. My husband loved the huge flat screen TV in our room. The staff was very helpful and check-in was easy. The continental breakfast was good and had plenty of selections. We had a view of the pool from our room and it looked clean and refreshing. I especially liked the business center because we were able to print our boarding passes for our return flight. The fitness center was nice and clean. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the business traveler!”
Reviews.Author: Siggy480
Reviews.Content: When you are traveling to San Diego there are a multitude of hotels to stay at. I travel to San Diego often and normally stay at the Double Tree in hotel circle. I believe the hotels in this area have become complacent in their thought that business travelers will stay there by default. Well, many people do and when this hotel was booked I looked elsewhere and found a gem. After a stay at the Hampton Inn San Diego - Kearny Mesa removed the thought that the Hampton Inn is the low-end hotel of Hilton properties. This property was the spotless a very important thing when looking for a hotel room. Perfect for the business traveler! The thing that really stood out to me from so many hotels is the staff. When looking for something to do in the area, they actually had recommendations and directions. ~Siggy480~

HotelInfo.Address: 5434 Kearny Mesa Road, San Diego, CA 92111
